item.title: The Mirage: How This Vegas Icon Ignited a Resort Revolution | Vintage Las Vegas History
item.description:
A Bold Vision: The Birth of a Mega-Resort

The Las Vegas Strip had seen its share of glitz and glamour, but in 1989, it was about to be shaken to its core. Enter the Mirage Hotel & Casino, officially opening its doors on November 22nd, after a grueling two-year construction period and a staggering $630 million investment â€“ the most expensive resort the world had seen at the time. Steve Wynn, a visionary with a reputation for pushing boundaries, was the driving force behind this ambitious project. Financed, somewhat controversially, through junk bonds, the Mirage was more than just a casino; it was a statement. For over fifteen years, no new mega-resorts had been built on the Strip, and Wynn intended to change that, ushering in a new era of Las Vegas luxury and entertainment.
